definitions: To lift something from a surface.
To learn a new skill or language without formal lessons.
To collect someone or something, often by car.
To buy something, especially cheaply or incidentally.
To resume something after an interruption.
examples: Please pick up the book from the floor.
She picked up Spanish quickly while living in Mexico.
I'll pick you up at the airport at 3 PM.
I managed to pick up a great bargain at the sale.
The microphone picked up every whisper.
He picked up a nasty cold on his trip.
Let's pick up where we left off yesterday.
